description: This module focuses on the emergence of the British novel as it develops from the early fiction of the late seventeenth century to the Regency novels of Jane Austen. We will read this famously amorphous genre through a variety historical and theoretical lenses, ranging from the rise of empiricism to the reconfiguration of gender roles to the eighteenth-century appetite for news and facts.
